intro: Miconia conochiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly found in Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences that bloom in vibrant colors. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
